_comment: Define what requires [PRODUCT_OWNER] approval vs automatic execution
_philosophy: High-level decisions need human approval, routine tasks execute automatically

requires_team_member_approval._comment: Specific team roles that must approve certain actions

approval_workflow._comment: How to request approval when needed

ai_behavior.when_approval_needed: Stop execution, present decision to [PRODUCT_OWNER], await response
ai_behavior.when_auto_execute: Execute immediately, log action, report completion

escalation_rules.rule_1: If task impacts production users → require approval
escalation_rules.rule_3: If task costs money → require approval
escalation_rules.rule_4: If task affects multiple team members → require approval
escalation_rules.rule_5: If task is routine maintenance → auto-execute

scenario_1.action: Update kanban card from Sprint → Live
scenario_1.reason: Routine task, documented in git history, reversible

scenario_2.reason: Major architectural decision, impacts entire team, not reversible

scenario_3.reason: Minor content change, no strategic impact, easily reversible

scenario_4.action: Change brand colors from green to red
scenario_4.reason: Major brand decision, affects user perception, requires stakeholder input
